Record Class DataSet<N extends Number>

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet<N>
Record Components:
samples - the samples to hold in this data set
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<DataSet.Sample<N>>
@DomainObject @Composition public record DataSet<N extends Number>(List<DataSet.Sample<N extends Number>> samples) extends Record implements Iterable<DataSet.Sample<N>>
Represents a data set. A data set consist of samples. A sample has inputs (e.g. features or signals) and corresponding expected outputs.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static interface 
    DataSet.Loader<N extends Number>
    Interface to load a data set.
    static final record 
    DataSet.Sample<N extends Number>
    The sample represents a single input for an estimation function and the corresponding expected outputs.

    • of

      @SafeVarargs @StaticFactory public static <N extends Number> DataSet<N> of(DataSet.Sample<N>... sample)
      Create a new data set for the given samples, where samples can't added or removed.
      Parameters:
      sample - the samples to put in the data set
      Returns:
      the data set

    • create

      @StaticFactory public static <N extends Number> DataSet<N> create()
      Creates a new empty data set

    • subset

      public DataSet<N> subset(int fromIndex, int toIndex)
      Creates a new data set that contains only a subset of samples. Useful for cutting a single data set into a training, validation, and test set.
      Parameters:
      fromIndex - the fromIndex inclusive
      toIndex - the toIndex exclusive
      Returns:
      the new data set containing only a subset of the samples
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the indexes are not properly given

      Adds the given sample to the data set
      Parameters:
      sample - the sample to add

    • addSample

      public void addSample(N[] features, N[] targetOutputs)
      Adds the given sample to the data set
      Parameters:
      features - the inputs for the sample
      targetOutputs - the expected outputs for the sample

    • removeSample

      public void removeSample(DataSet.Sample<N> sample)
      Removes the first occurrence of the sample of the data set. No-op if not present.
      Parameters:
      sample - the sample to remove

    • getFeatureCount

      public int getFeatureCount()
      Returns the number of features in this data set.

      The feature count corresponds to the dimensionality of the input vector (the arity of the function being trained or estimated). This is typically the number of independent variables or input attributes provided by the dataset.

      Returns:
      the number of input features in this sample

    • getTargetCount

      public int getTargetCount()
      Returns the number of target outputs in this data set.

      The target count corresponds to the dimensionality of the expected output vector (the co-arity of the function being trained or estimated). This is typically the number of dependent variables, labels, or regression targets provided by the dataset.

      Returns:
      the number of target outputs in this sample

    • iterator

      public Iterator<DataSet.Sample<N>> iterator()
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<N extends Number>

    • isCompatibleWith

      public boolean isCompatibleWith(EstimationFunction<N> estimationFunction)
      Checks whether this dataset is compatible with the given estimation function.

      A dataset is considered compatible if:

      • its feature count per sample equals the function's arity(), and
      • its target count per sample equals the function's coArity().
      Parameters:
      estimationFunction - the estimation function to compare against
      Returns:
      true if the dataset matches the function's input/output schema; false otherwise

    • compatible

      public DataSet<N> compatible(EstimationFunction<N> estimationFunction)
      Ensures that this DataSet is compatible with the given EstimationFunction.

      Compatibility typically means that the structure of the dataset (e.g., feature dimensionality, output dimensionality) matches the requirements of the estimation function. This method is a guard to prevent training or evaluation with mismatched models and datasets.

      If the dataset is compatible, this method returns the current instance for fluent chaining. If it is not compatible, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      estimationFunction - the estimation function to check against
      Returns:
      this dataset, if compatible
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the dataset is not compatible with the given estimation function
